official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require personal disclosure statements in all
			 third-party communications advocating the election or defeat of a
			 candidate, to require the disclosure of identifying information within
			 paid communications made through the Internet, to apply disclosure
			 requirements to prerecorded telephone calls, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Stand By Every Ad Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stand By Every Ad Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Requiring Personal Disclosure Statements in Express Advocacy Communications

quote.#text: clearly identified candidate or consisting of the functional equivalent of express advocacy,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 318(a) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971

header.#text:
Application of Disclosure Requirements to Communications Consisting of Functional Equivalent of

text.#text: Any communication described in

text.#text: in the case of the individual disclosure statement described in

In the case of a communication to which this paragraph applies which is transmitted through radio,
			 the disclosure statements required under

shall appear in writing at the end of the communication in a clearly readable manner, with a
			 reasonable degree of color contrast between the background and the printed
			 statement, for a period of at least 4 seconds; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or the
			 organization disclosure statement described in

, shall be
			 conveyed by an unobscured, full-screen view of the applicable individual,
			 or by the applicable individual making the statement in voice-over
			 accompanied by a clearly identifiable photograph or similar image of the
			 individual.

text.#text: in the case of the individual disclosure statement described in

In the case of a communication to which this paragraph applies which is transmitted through
			 television, the disclosure statements required under

quote.#tail: , with the blank filled in with the name of the applicable individual.
quote.#text: I am _______, and I am responsible for the content of this advertising.

text.#text: The individual disclosure statement described in this subparagraph is the following:
the first blank to be filled in with the name of the applicable individual;
the second blank to be filled in with the title of the applicable individual; and

the third and fourth blank each to be filled in with the name of the person paying for the
			 communication.

quote.#text:
I am _______, the _______ of _______, and _______ is responsible for the content of this
			 advertising.

text.#text: The organizational disclosure statement described in this subparagraph is the following:
if the communication is paid for by an individual, the individual paying for the communication;

if the communication is paid for by a labor organization, the highest ranking officer of the labor
			 organization; or

if the communication is paid for by any other person, the president, chief executive officer,
			 highest ranking official, or similar officer of the person who serves in
			 an executive, decisionmaking capacity with respect to the making of
			 communications to which this paragraph applies.

term.#tail: means, with respect to a communication to which this paragraph applies—

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act or the amendments made by this Act may be construed to require any person who
			 is not required under

external-xref.#tail:
of title 11 of the Code of Federal
			 Regulations) to include a disclaimer on communications made by the person
			 through the Internet to include any disclaimer on any such communications.

header.#text: No Expansion of Persons Subject to Disclaimer Requirements on Internet Communications

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to
			 communications made on or after the expiration of the 90-day period which
			 begins on the date of the enactment of this Act.
